website_summaries.verdict: A straightforward and reliable option from a big name in single-serve coffee makers.
pros: Compatible with all K-cups, including My K-Cup reusable pods and generic pods
Offers a choice of four cup sizes (6, 8, 10, or 12 oz.)
cons: Feels flimsy compared to similar models

customer_reviews.title: My morning hero!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this coffee machine - it is so beautiful and easy to use. The color is stunning with my kitchen decor. My husband (who does not drink coffee - I know!) even finds this really simple to use when making me my morning pick me up and there are a huge variety of pods you can use with it. * If you found my review helpful, I would love for you to let me know by clicking the 'helpful' button!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: There appears to be a design or manufacturing flaw in this coffee maker. Amazon Customer Service have been really good about replacing units, but I am now getting a 3rd unit shipped to me (at no additional cost, I might add). The first 2 units have the same problem: Water flows into the cup before any cup-size button has been pressed, and the water is cold. Maybe the 3rd unit will be okay, but I'm not confident that it will be. ***Update: The 3rd unit malfunctions just like the other two. Unless the manufacturer can convince you that they have fixed the problem, stay away from this model.***
customer_reviews.author: madlink

customer_reviews.title: Pay more money for a better Keurig, or better yet
customer_reviews.text: Pay more money for a better Keurig, or better yet.....buy Cuisinart. They make a better product. This machine is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Jo

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: The plastic material that it is made of is not as sturdy as my previous Keurig. And I keep having the water that goes through the coffee pod keep overflowing and getting coffee grounds, coffee, etc everywhere. I've repeatedly taken it apart and cleaned it, but that keeps happening. Unfortunately seems to be another example of what was once a really good product not being so good anymore. Disappointed. Updated Feb 2020: Not happy with this, would return if I still could. Continual problem with grounds overflowing. Cleaning the needles does not help, trying many different kinds of pods does not help. Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Worst model - STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I must agree with other reviews, too many flaws. I was in desperate need of keurig, I’m a 911 dispatcher and coffee gets me through a shift, a reliable and simple machine is critical. Last night first time using and every review relating to flaws occurred, totally unsatisfied. Will be returning or simply tossing in garbage. I’ve owned many keurigs and this by far is the first pos I have ever dealt with
customer_reviews.author: Wmfdrich

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I had plodded along with a single serve Keurig for years and finally decided to buy one that would make more cups of coffee without doing a whole refill process. I really like this model. It doesn't take very long for the water to heat and then it can make multiple cups without waiting long for the next cup's water to be hot.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I liked the cup size selections
customer_reviews.text: I liked the cup size selections. This coffee maker only works when it wants to. We often have to try multiple times to get it to make a cup of coffee. It makes the first cup in the morning just fine and after that it gets temperamental.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months, my coffee maker has stopped working. It simply does not brew coffee. Now I am getting the run around on my warranty claim. I was sent to a parts listing so I can repair it myself. I don’t know why it stopped working, therefore I don’t know what parts are needed. BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick S

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Love the white
customer_reviews.text: Love this Keurig!! Purchased to replace one I already have and love the 4 cup sizes! Also love that I can brew in bold mode ❤️ Would recommend this to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but does not match other similarly named  color accessories.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great; however, the "vintage red" color is more of a burgundy that doesn't match other "vintage red" kitchen accessories like our Kitchen Aide mixer or ice maker. In terms of usability it is similar to the original Kuerig, just really suped up. You can make both larger and smaller cups of hot beverages compared to the original Kuerig which is a big bonus for us because we have oversized cups that weren't quite filled when we used our original Kuerig. Buyer beware the color matching, probably best to go with black unless you're able to color match
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great color and function
customer_reviews.text: This Kuerig is so pretty and I've had no issues with it at all. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working !!!
customer_reviews.text: Was working great. We make about 3-5 cups a day. Made coffee in morning and a few hours later tried to make more ... nothing!!! Turned on, put in pod, select cup size ... nothing!!! Sounds like a dieing car trying to run!! Just got it Dec13, less then a month !!! Returning it, will not get another!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Ray Rivera

customer_reviews.title: The lightest and most efficient coffee machine EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine is very lightweight, very efficient and quick brewing. It hardly makes any noise! I had to put my ear close enough to make sure it was working. It only makes a little noise when the coffee if finally dripping into the cup, but that's expected. Also it was very user-friendly to install. I had mine up and running in under 10mins. I love the matte finish of the plastic, making it finger smudge proof and easy to wipe. I truly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for a single guy drinking a cup or two of coffee a day!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 2 cups of coffee a day. This unit is good because of the water reservoir, the speed it takes to heat the water, and the user's ability to choose cup sizes (up to 12 oz). It's fast and pretty quiet. Now to save money on the pods I bought the 4 reusable k-cup solo filters so I can brew my own coffee's from organic deluxe to Folger's Classic and they all taste good. If you need to put your "roadie" cup in there to take with you, it's possible to remove the base to allow for the taller cup. All in all is a very good entry level Keurig for me that is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tommyray

customer_reviews.title: Keurig quality has gone down substantially!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the Keurig has gone down substantially they make a cheaper version and charge the same price, very disappointed with this purchase and will not purchase another Keurig have used the product since they first came out had three of Originals in the first 10 years this one hasn't lasted six months. I'll definitely look at other brands for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Margot

customer_reviews.title: Must have bought a Lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I have had Keurigs for many years and have used them until I wore them out. But this one has died after only 2 months! Past the return date so am stuck but am so disappointed. It is hard to find white Keurigs anymore and was so was excited when I found this one. Definitely bought a lemon and am sour about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cw6078

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of plastic spend a little more
customer_reviews.text: Well it looked cool in the picture but it is a waste of plastic cheap cheap cheap wish I would’ve spent a little more. I purchased the 60s colored one and coffee splatters everywhere and it looks terrible you have to clean it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Bk Morguloff Properties

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor Quality Part on This Keurig Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I received this coffee maker on May 28, 2018. Approximately two months later, I had to call Keurig to get a replacement part for the plastic water receptacle. It had literally cracked and fell into four pieces. Keurig replaced that for free. Today, September 20, 2018, the replacement part cracked down one side. I did not take either water receptacle on and off to refill the water, but rather I filled it by using a water pitcher. I am calling Amazon tomorrow to complain about this problem. I want my money back or a credit given to my account. To avoid frustration and disappointment, stay away from this model of a Keurig coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: This machine does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. My old Coffee Maker died, and I decided to give a Keurig a try. Several problems that I had with my old machine have been resolved by getting this Keurig. Now I can have a cup of coffee, hot tea or hot chocolate when ever I want within about a minute. And the drink is HOT, VERY HOT as soon as it hits my cup. This machine does exactly what it is supposed to do. My Keurig makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Spillane Sr

customer_reviews.title: What a joke!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the color - goes perfect in my kitchen. Can get a cup of coffee first thing. UPDATE: Very disappointed in this item. When purchased no where does it say you have to use 'bottled or tap" water in your machine. I have a water filtration system and my Keurig kept jamming. Called the company about it and they suggested to change my water as their machine has problems with filtered water!? SAY WHAT???? That's the craziest thing I have ever heard! Needless to say I have lost a lot of respect for Keurig!
customer_reviews.author: Colybean

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was very sceptical about order it off of Amazon instead of going to a store and getting it because you never know what your going to get. But it came exactly how I seen it at target same price. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Warren Blevins

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY  RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine. Already tried it out with tea, coffee and hot chocolate. All are GREAT! I would recommend this to anyone. Now my favorite appliance in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Wood

customer_reviews.title: Grounds Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: We have used a Keurig for ages. When our old one died, we didn't hesitate to purchase a new one. We have had it for about 6 months and it's given us trouble from the start. I don't know why, but about every 2nd or 3rd kcup virtually explodes. (See pics) It always feels like winning a bad lottery. This morning, the problem evolved--now every kcup explodes and there is a liquid overflow. There's no good resolution for us, since the warranty is expired, but we can serve as a warning to others. Do your research and don't trust these are better just because of their name.
customer_reviews.author: JeriJetTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 recommend if you like coffee and other hot drinks
customer_reviews.text: So far so good this is our second one in 6 years so I can’t complain. When have had this model for about 2 months now and it heats up as it says. The charcoal filter is a nice touch and makes me less worried about how clean it is inside. Please not if you make hot cocoa while using the pods you must clean the pod holder often. Otherwise, it will back up and won’t work right for several minutes. this happened to us several times before were came to this conclusion and hasn’t happened since cleaning it weekly.
customer_reviews.author: MC_Hammertoes

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned After 1 Week Using Distilled Water
customer_reviews.text: After only one week in use, the unit started continuously pumping cold water . It kept pumping water out, regardless of whether the K-cup holder was open or closed, until the reservoir was empty or the unit was unplugged. As soon as it was plugged back in and turned on, it started pumping again. I contacted Keurig and have updated this review: UPDATE: Keurig told me that this problem can be caused by using distilled water in the unit, and switching to drinking water appears to have solved the problem. This, despite having used distilled water for several years in our previous Keurig B60, thinking it would cut down on the need to descale.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS MODEL - SEE REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE ONLY HAD THIS 6 MONTHS AND ALL OF A SUDDEN THE WATER DISPENSES WHENEVER THE POWER IS ON AND DOES NOT STOP - I READ MANY REVIEWS WITH THE SAME ISSUE - WHILE THIS WORKED GREAT FOR 6 MONTHS IT NOW HAS TO BE REPLACED AND IT CANNOT BE RETURNED - I WILL NOT BE PURCHASING TIHS AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Rex Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love the color options and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the look. It's beautiful I love all the different color options that are available We went with the teal one and I love it. We replaced our keurig from 2015 and upgraded for this one. It is much quieter and has more options for cup size. However I feel it's way over priced. When feeling a cup it spits coffee all over and you have to constantly clean the whole front of the Keurig. So if you don't mind cleaning it after every use then it's perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Harden

customer_reviews.title: A dangerous, frustrating hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have noted, often the Keurig brewer dispenses water almost immediately after merely turning it on, and with no other buttons selected. This morning it drained the entire reservoir. Pump was still running even after the reservoir was completely empty. I unplugged the unit, waited a couple minutes, plugged it back in, yet water continued pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Revisborne

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee. Easy quick brew.
customer_reviews.text: It is loud like a previous reviewer stated, but that doesn’t bother me that much. I can tell when coffee is done. I am upgrading from a Keurig without a reservoir so this should be a treat for me. I just received and tested today and will try and update in a week or so. Love the Vintage Red. UPDATE 10/30: really like this coffee maker and have increased to five stars. Great coffee no matter the cup size. Make sure you use the “quick start” feature.
customer_reviews.author: E A Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Keurig's simpliest brewer yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Keurig brewer and I like this one more than any other. This brewer will give hot water by just selecting the amount of ounces you need. I used to keep a self-fill K-cup in the brewer to get hot water. It is so nice to get hot water at the press of a button! It also brews a delightful cup of coffee. I believe that this brewer blows more of the water out of the K-cup when done. I also believe that the cup of coffee is hotter than with my old brewer. I love the simple controls and don't miss the display that was on my other brewers at all! Would definitely recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie56

customer_reviews.title: LEAKING
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Keurig for about a week now, and it has leaked from the bottom twice. Huge puddles have formed under the machine after brewing a cup, and I'm not sure where it is coming from. Everything seems to be in it's proper place. I'm going to give it another week but if it continues, I am going to need a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an older Keurig and I love this one! My old one did not have a water reservoir and you could not choose the strength of your coffee either, both of which I love. My most favorite thing though is the color. It blends perfectly in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: B. Denise

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few bucks more...
customer_reviews.text: Everything about his model brewer from Keurig turns me off. It feels cheap, very thin and light material. Every time I go to remove a pod after brewing, the pod holder dislodges itself from the brewer. Out of the first several cups we made, water came pouring out over the front of the machine. Now I seem to be getting a lot of grounds in my coffee. Should have spent a little more money and purchased the higher priced unit. The model we had for four or five years that just died, they don't make it anymore - Go Figure. Probably will always buy Keurig brewers, just purchased the wrong model.
customer_reviews.author: dgw

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I had my old Keurig for many, many years...probably at least 5 years. It finally stopped brewing k-cups. I researched several models before deciding on this one. As I said...so far, so good. I do like the "strong" feature very much. This machine is also much less noisy. The noise with the old one didn't really bother me. I'm just pointing out the difference and that change can be good.
customer_reviews.author: J Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Plastic....
customer_reviews.text: It's always sad when you see the first commitment from a manufacturer to lower their standards and quality in favor of (I assume) profits... I have for the past 5 years or so purchased a new Keurig each year... sometimes a higher-priced one, other times just a basic one. This year marked the first year when I purchased what I thought was mid-range unit but received a product substantially less impressive than I was expecting. This unit screams plastic... it feels like something out of the 70's only without any of the cool 70's retro. In a nutshell, for me personally, this year Keurig is going to result in me purchasing a different manufacturer next year. Very disappointing Keurig!
customer_reviews.author: Warrick Price

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure when you hook it up if the water does not pull through. pull out the filter run a cup through, then put the filter back in and do it again sometimes it just doesn't sit right with the filter upon the first cup of coffee pulled. Register your keurig because the people at keurig will replace it for free if they don't feel like telling you how to work on it either.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C. Oprel

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and lovely color
customer_reviews.text: I got this when I noticed my roommates and I were spending an awful lot of money at the local coffee shops, and risking more Covid exposure on top of that. It’s been great so far and has definitely saved each of us a ton of money that has likely paid for the keurig already. Even though they didn’t pitch in... (you’re welcome roomies). I also like the navy blue color which is nice in our white kitchen with other blue items. Only complaint so far is the tray comes off way too easily. Like you even look at it a certain way and it panics and flops off. So dramatic.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Keurig K-Select Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, With Strength Control and Hot Water On Demand
customer_reviews.text: I really, really love the Keurig. The only thing wrong with it is the cover for the water container. Sometimes the cover looks as if it is securely on the water container and then when you close the pod container it knocks the lid/cover off of the water container. It only happens occasionally so it is not something I would complain about, however it is annoying. I have never had a Kuerig but the one we had at my last job never had this problem, so I thought I would mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie A. Bell

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I wish Keurig would get their designs refined. This is my fourth brewer and each one had its own "personality". They work but each one had small glitches in there performance. After making millions of units I'd think they could get the design, manufacture, and assembly right. I tolerate its flaws but wish they had some credible competition.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Quality, looks, and good coffee.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a Keurig, it’s made to be simple and look good. This one is no exception...works flawlessly and looks good on our marble countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: JUNK. Purchased 5/28/19, broke 7/19/19. Light use.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Amazon stood behind product, am very appreciative of customer service! BYE KEURIG. Done. Never again. Been a faithful user for more years than I can count. Each machine lasted a little less time than the last. This one, less than two months. Using spring water. Quality coffee pods. Light use. Clean. Half cups. Then - Starts to drip, machine turns off. Junk. Of course, tossed the box last month. 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Roosa

customer_reviews.title: Makes good hot coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Because I'm the only one that drinks coffee, I don't mind that the water reservoir only makes 3 cups before needing to be refilled. However, it's easy to refill and the coffee is hotter than any other coffee maker I've used which I love because I don't have to gulp it before it gets cold! I bought the white and it looks great and it's compact so it works well if you have limited counter space.
customer_reviews.author: tlf

customer_reviews.title: A change from the older models
customer_reviews.text: This is maybe my 5th Keurig machine. Of all the ones I used, the only one I wouldn’t do again is the one made for Walmart. This one is a nice neural color, the lid fits much better on the water reservoir and it brews to a wonderful flavor. If I could have one wish it would be a larger water reservoir because I’m refilling every bb other day.
customer_reviews.author: CMD925

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Useful Kitchen addition
customer_reviews.text: I barely drink one cup of coffee at a time, so larger coffee makers are usually super wasteful to me. Kuerig + reusable pods (never disposable) works perfect for me. If you want stronger coffee, this isn't the machine for you, but as I am more of a latte person, this is amazing. The only thing with the nice blue color is that it gets dirty with coffee quite easily and requires daily cleaning, which I don't mind, but if that thing bothers you, go for black.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Not good!
customer_reviews.text: The product obviously has been used. When I opened the box water came out of the reservoir. The Kruig box had a clearance label from Walmart $49.00. The box was taped up and busted up. This was a birthday gift, not a re gift. Disappointing! Star rating less than 1
customer_reviews.author: MARGI BESHORE

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine, but does drip water now and then like some reviews have said
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this Keurig for almost a month and so far it is working fine. Once in a while when I hit the button to heat up the water (before making a cup of coffee), it spouts out drips of water and I have to quickly dump the water out of the mug before I start the coffee making. I’ve seen other reviews nothing this issue and some people had major leaks (yikes!) so I hope this will not be the case for me down the line. SO far I’m okay with the little drips of water, but if it gushes out and floods my kitchen counter, then that’s another matter.
customer_reviews.author: AMom

customer_reviews.title: Did me right
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got leaked from the bottom when used. I got on the Keurig site and ran through their "try this first" stuff, which didn't help, then called their number. Very courteous and professional! They talked me through making sure I had done the "try this first" stuff, which I would expect, then immediately shipped out a replacement. They did ask me to ship the bad one back (at their expense). The impression I got is that they wanted to see what the problem was for their own product improvement. Second one has worked like a champ. It has all the features that I wanted and delivers a good quality cup.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Water container is too small, Looks and feels a bit cheap - go with the K-Elite instead!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my ORIGINAL model Keurig. I was unhappily surprised to find the water holder on this unit is ridiculously small. Otherwise, works as advertised. Design looks cheap and plastic. Follow up: After about 2 months I purchased the K-Elite model. I highly recommend the K-Elite over this K-Select version. The K-Elite is MUCH nicer. The build look and feel is very high-end. The water holder is SIGNIFICANTLY larger than the K-Select. You also get much more control with programming on/off times & auto shut-off, as well as water temperature of the brew. The K-Select produces coffee that is initially scaldingly hot.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald W. Mcbride

customer_reviews.title: Nice Keurig with a couple of caveats
customer_reviews.text: This makes great-tasting coffee. There are 2 issues I have with it: 1. It does not always make the same amount of coffee on the largest cup setting and, 2. The reservoir is undersized requiring frequent filling (however, removal, filling, and reinstalling the reservoir is a breeze). I'm the only one in the family that drinks coffee so this model works well for me. I'd recommend a model with a larger water capacity for a family of coffee drinkers.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, clean, delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and made my first cup of coffee. What a delight! I read so many reviews stating that these machines break quickly and so I bought a competitor’s coffee maker. Big mistake. It was ridiculously loud, coffee splattered everywhere, and the water tank was hard to seat causing an error code that directed you to call customer service. I boxed it up and returned. How nice to now brew a quiet cup of delicious coffee without the splatters. Fingers crossed the unit will last. All my family members have keurigs and they are going strong after a few years.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer leigh

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheaplt constructed. Gentleman's "C" at best
customer_reviews.text: I'm very surprised at the cheap feeling of This coffee maker. The plastic sounds very hollow and ...cheap. I would not have expected this from a products with the brand ID that Keurig has. I do enjoy the basic functionalities and convenience of this coffee maker. This is the first Keurig I've ever owned. I'm quite certain that if I had seen this in person in the store as opposed to just a picture online I would never have bought it. It shouldn't feel so chintzy at a $129.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Wagger

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed 2 distinctive and major issues pointed out by other reviewers. Either water randomly spouts out after turning it on or the machine shuts itself off constantly. Unfortunately, my machine falls into the latter category. I've only had it for about 9 months and only make around 3 cups of coffee a week. Today my machine stopped working in the middle of brewing a cup of coffee. The power just shut off. The power would come back on immediately after pushing the button, but it can no longer stay on long enough to make a full cup. After struggling with it for an hour, I just gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T. Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Very weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back. For me, it was just too weak of a coffee. I tried many kinds of pods and the kind you fill up yourself. Even though I used the strong brew and tried all the serving sizes it was too weak for me. I wanted it to make fast iced coffee so this would not work. My mother has a different Keri’s and I liked hers and gave this a try. It is fast and so convenient. If you prefer weak coffee, you may love this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product- we use heavily
customer_reviews.text: We use this k select often throughout the day and night! I love the cup and strength selector and the big water reservoir!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with K-Select model
customer_reviews.text: Pods are expensive but the convenience the machine offers and ability to brew one cup at a time is very nice. My son and I both have this model (K-Select) and they work quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy W

customer_reviews.title: Love this Kuerig
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this Keurig! I’ve only used the Keurig brand of pods, but it quickly makes a good, hot, cup of coffee. The only minor issue I have is it can be a slight bit cumbersome reattaching the water resorvoir if you completely fill it. Keurig did not make a handle or anything to hold, so you basically have to hold it with both hands and try to slide it into place. If the resorvoir is not properly seated, you will know because the low water light will stay lit. Another thing I discovered is that the low water indicator will not go out if the filter is clogged.
customer_reviews.author: WonderWoman

customer_reviews.title: Newer isn’t always better!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved my Keurig. My first lasted over 10 years; however, they clearly are cutting corners. It’s all plastic, but my dislike really lies in the fact that it drips badly, I have to keep a cup under it for all the random dripping. Sometimes it just drips out almost as much as when it’s brewing a cup, then it will slow down and eventually stop for a while. Never had this problem with my first one. I will however, give kudos for the weight. It’s isn’t near a heavy as the original.
customer_reviews.author: lilgppr

customer_reviews.title: Use this every day and am not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you’re like me then you can’t survive a day without coffee....or 3. When this arrived I was like a kid at a candy shop because my old keurig was on its last leg. The best part about this one for me is the strong button that it has. I use this to make my first cup of coffee and it definitely helps. It’s also very easy to clean, as some coffee splashes up and gets onto the machine when it’s brewing, but that’s just how life goes right? Minor inconvenience but I’ve seen that happen with many different brands of coffee makers.
customer_reviews.author: Amm

customer_reviews.title: Keurig does it again.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old Keurig that was used every day for 8 plus years. Love my new one! It is so much quieter than the old and has clean lines and great design. It is smaller and takes up less counter space. I like the color too, black is so boring.
customer_reviews.author: Knit-shop-repeat

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Keurig, my first was silver, my second was red, the cord on the red one was longer and was behind my toaster oven and unknowingly became melted, so I had to get rid of that one, I brought my old silver one out and it was still working great. I ordered this one because I wanted the one that would hold water And have a choice of a cup size and Brew Strength. I really love the color, my wall is shaker beige and this blends right into it and it’s not real noticeable. I have one large cup of coffee in the morning, this brought me a large cup and was the strength I love
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made and Brews a WEAK Cup of Coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after our ten year old Keurig bit the dust. First thing I noticed when opening the package is how cheap and flimsy the material is. The older model was MUCH more substantial and well made. Brewed my first cup of coffee and it was WEAK! Tried different cup sizes as well as the feature to enhance strength and nothing worked. Returned this product and won’t be purchasing a Keurig again unless I can find one like they used to make.
customer_reviews.author: j-atx

customer_reviews.title: Water reservoir is amaller than some earlier models
customer_reviews.text: I liked my other keurig better, the water tank held more water and I wasn't constantly having to refill it. I do like the ability to make the coffee stronger or regular strength. The instructions could have been in a larger font. We old folks can't read small fonts. It's printed on a small piece of paper as though the manufacturer had to save paper - of course, every penny counts!
customer_reviews.author: A.. Vidrick

customer_reviews.title: Love my white keurig
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a white keurig that matches my coffee bar station. I was looking for something simple, something that i can just press one button to start my coffee. Me and my husband love it, i totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ivonne Perez

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked okay for about 3 weeks. Then the water started coming out from the top of the pod area and I had grounds and water all over. After cleaning it was okay but now it will only make hot water. I put in the pod, close the lid, and push the brew size to only have the machine push thru a couple of drops of water and stop brewing. I had a keurig for a long time before but obviously they are useless now. Amazon is amazing with helping to resolve this and even is offering a refund. I would definitely recommend Amazon but not keurig.
customer_reviews.author: cathleen thompson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COFFE POT FOR THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: MY COFFEE TASTE GREAT! NICE SMALLER KEURIG POT EASY TO USE. MY OTHER ONE WAS MORE EXPENSIVE (KEURIG) LASTED FOR YEARS. THIS ONE MAKES YOUR COFEE TASTE WONDERFUL TOO. I AM PLEASED WITH MY PURCHASE. BUY IT YOU WONT BE SORRY. I LOVE MY MORNING COFFEE :)
customer_reviews.author: CAROL  DENNY

customer_reviews.title: ZERO STARS!! UPDATED!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on 12/11.. Opened Christmas morning. Put into service 2 weeks ago. Already dead - water will not feed from the reservoir into the coffeemaker.. What the heck is up with Keurig products? Am calling customer service as soon as they open for business! Will update after the call! This is my FOURTH Keurig in THREE YEARS!!!........ UPDATE - Keruig replaced the faulty brewer in January.. The replacement FAILED yesterday, April 29.. What does it take to get a reliable brewer from Keruig?? This is beyond words..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Not my Cup of Tea
customer_reviews.text: Although I love the Idea of this single serve and this is an excellent brand, it seems that all the grounds Used are only using those directly under the stream. You just don’t get the full bodied cup of coffee from these machines. I feel cheated and buying coffee that gets wasted. That’s just my opinion. I’m returning it all and buying another drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Krybaby1

customer_reviews.title: Love the navy blue?
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it was navy blue and matched my kitchen. Monday was first day asked to stay home. My keurig broke. Power button just emptied the whole reservoir of cold water into the cup. So I ordered the blue one and pitched the broken one. It said arrive Saturday. Then on Tuesday it said Thursday. Then on Wednesday it arrived. That was awesome to get it so quickly. Only comment my old one lit up cup sizes when water was hot. This one you listen for motor sound to change and close door over pod. Then cup sizes light up
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: 10  months - and it leaks - BUT... Keurig stands tall with customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Keurig responded w/in hours. Provided a phone number, and the gentleman is sending a NEW machine. He could have just sent a new water reservoir - but they stood behind the warranty 110%, and a new machine is on the way. I'll give 10 starts for customer service. ************************************ Love the machine, but wondered why there was water all around the machine. Thought the husband just kept missing - but he asked me about it today and I realized it just leaks. Hopefully at 10 months, Keurig will stand by their product and replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Conenient coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Like Keurig coffee makers cuz easy to use, convenient, and good coffee results. However this is the 4th Kerrigan we have purchased because the electronics fail around 4 years of use. I don’t like this model because the water tank lid is poorly designed and falls off. Also, we run out of water very fast because the amount held is of low volume. Has a water filter which may be a sales gimmick. Need to watch how descale gets is done. The Keurig brand descale gets item is expensive and works the same a store purchased cleaning viniger.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Should've spent the extra for the Elite
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace our K475 which we dearly loved but was beginning to show signs of age. The water reservoir is smaller and narrower which makes filling hit or miss. It does not heat the water nearly hot enough. The "strong" setting has absolutely no effect. Hot water drips out of the used pods and burns your hands when you try to discard them.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Daze

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and maintain
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this item multiple times a day for the last two months and have had no problems with it. It is easy to operate and clean. The water reservoir holds less volume than the Keurig which this unit replaced after many years of hard use. This is really not a major inconvenience even for a household that consists of heavy consumers of coffee such as ours. I especially like the features which allow you to select the volume and strength of the coffee you desire at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Ray J.

customer_reviews.title: Best Keurig ever
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews that were like 1 star saying that grounds went everywhere but then one of the review said that the K-cup was bad. Sure enough I tested one of my cheap K cups and it didn’t poke through. So I push down on the cup before I close the lid and I haven’t had a problem. The first cup of the day takes a little time for the element to heat but after that as long as it stays ON then the coffee is immediate!! I am so glad I bought this model.
customer_reviews.author: Envy224

customer_reviews.title: The perfect addition.
customer_reviews.text: We have owned a Keurig or two...but our last one started going downhill quickly. Found this one which matches our color in the kitchen. Much MUCH nicer than out last one!!! This one is the best one so far. Sleek design and color choices make it our favorite thing in the kitchen. Just wish I could get the rest of our appliances to match like this one does. The options for cup choices make it a favorite of everyone in our house, including our guests that visit from time to time. Now I get to be my wife's new hero for picking this one out without any guidance!
customer_reviews.author: Trichia Yates

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had this Keurig for just shy of a month. Worked great, quiet and easy to use. 3 nights in a row the machine shuts off during the filling and when you open the K-cup compartment, grounds and hot water go everywhere. I cleaned it up and thought maybe it was because of generic store K-cups so I tried brand name and the same thing happened. Did multiple cleaning cycles and nothing helped. It still randomly shuts off even when cleaning or running hot water through it. I was really disappointed with this machine and it malfunctioning. I am hesitant to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but...not sure how long it will work....
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for first couple weeks. Making a weird noise now. I hope it keeps working. To expensive to buy again. Update: unit is now not delivering correct amount of water
customer_reviews.author: Michi

customer_reviews.title: not the machine I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I have used keurig Products for years. My first coffee maker lasted six years, that was quite impressive my second coffee maker lasted five again quite impressive. But this select model, is substandard. It’s made out of cheap plastic, it spits water all over the place, and it’s always a mess to clean up after you make a cuppa coffee. I am so very disappointed with this product for the premium price we pay for both coffee and coffee machines, I expect a lot more out of keurig to produce a premium product.
customer_reviews.author: KarenB_AZ

customer_reviews.title: Good brewer.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old Keurig that got clogged despite cleaning it and the motor gave out. This model has a nice feature to increase brew strength with a slower brew and 4 different sizes vs the 3 my old machine had. No issues to date I’ve had it > 6 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The color is close to a cranberry shade of red
customer_reviews.text: It was time to replace my obsolete Vue brewer. I chose this model because it brews 12 oz cups (great for travel mugs!), and most other K-cup models do not. I bought the Vintage Red because it was less expensive than the other colors available. I was pleased to see that the color is close to a cranberry and looks nice in my kitchen. It does make a loud noise while first warming up, but that does not last long.
customer_reviews.author: MARNI STRIKS

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kurig for my husband’s office. He has a satellite office and is the only one using the machine. Two weeks ago the coffee machine started just continued to fill and water was going everywhere. Then it worked for 1 day. We went on vacation and yesterday when he returned to his office. The Kurig again continued to flow water, it was running all over everything once again,
customer_reviews.author: SRH

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Started having trouble at random times from day one with this thing refusing to work, but just shutting itself off after a few drops. Now, less than two months after purchase, shuts itself off after a few drops of coffee and no longer works even randomly. Apparently a computer problem because it does not need descaling, and all lights are go-ahead. I should have known better. It was made in China. Do yourself a favor and choose something else.
customer_reviews.author: DI

customer_reviews.title: I love the STRONG button!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Keurig and I like it. I should have known "sandstone" would not match our gray kitchen but i was tired of black. The STRONG button is a great new feature. I think flavor depends on the coffee you use. My husband only has one (not very strong) cup in the morning and I have 2 or 3 strong ones and usually a couple of cups of decaf in the evening. This Keurig enables us both to have what we want and it's always fresh and the right strength.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cynthia Smith Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Let’s You Know when to descale🎉🎉
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Keurig. It’s so light, easy to use. My favorite is the strong button. I drink decaf because I have to. This button brings on a stronger wonderful cup of decaf. The new retro red is just stunning. Not loud but makes a statement. I highly recommend this wonderful unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maria

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, stains very easy
customer_reviews.text: Small, constantly refilling water because the reservoir is small, color stains very easy with coffee. Over priced for the color. Not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K. Jester

customer_reviews.title: Brews fine but splashes
customer_reviews.text: We have had Keurig machines for several years. This model works fine but doesn't seem to be as sturdy as the other models we've had. The thing that I don't like the most is that when the coffee is being brewed into the cup, the coffee splashes onto the machine behind the cup more than any other model we have had & onto to counter a little as well. Easy to wipe off, just annoying. Love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Keurig for the price
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker looks and feels cheaply made. It is very slow in brewing and doesn't hold much water. The "add water" light comes on prematurely while there is still 1/2 a tank of water still. For $126.00 this should be MUCH nicer than it is. Must have been made in China. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Tashi

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As My First Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Keurig purchase. The quality from Keurig seems cheaper in some way. Flimsy looking to me. This in no way, is a reflection on the seller. Just seems like the manufacturer made things with a cheaper quality of materials to mass produce them. I mean, it works and that’s what matters. I don’t care for the auto shut off. You have to wait for the water to heat up each time. It isn’t that long, but you have to wait rather than just straight to brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Teenster

customer_reviews.title: Filling water non stop
customer_reviews.text: Hey its a coffee maker but while we are asking what we don't like I will just say that for one thing, it doesn't hold a large amount of water. You will get about 3 Large coffee cups of coffee before ya have to refill. The other annoying thing is that as the coffee nears the end of the brewing it begins to splatter coffee into the cup making it spray around. The backsplash behind the cup needs to be wiped on a weekly basis....
customer_reviews.author: PJW

customer_reviews.title: The Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This is my second machine. The first one lasted for over ten years. This one seems slightly more cheaply made with thinner plastic. Also, the joints are not as tightly fitted as the first machine. That first machine was an engineering marvel in that respect. The water chamber is smaller which means filling it more frequently. On a positive note, I like the "strong " button option, and the fact that you can choose your cup size before putting the pod in. Overall an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker we've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband and he loves it! I'm so glad because he's so picky about things. It's easy to use and is fast making the coffee. He uses it every day. After 2 months of use, he's not had any problems whatsoever. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Crazishopr

customer_reviews.title: Plastic junk.  Barely lasted six months.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older Keurig (that I had for years) with this one, when the air pump went out. This started breaking into pieces within a couple of months. In about six months the plastic water reservoir had cracked and would no longer hold water. This model is all cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Fahey

customer_reviews.title: Great bamebrand
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple machine, bought it for moms for mother’s day and she loves it. It’s straight forward with pictures on the buttons to show what they do. Warms up fast and makes a solid cup of coffee. Only issue I have with these machines is that it always only fills the coffee cup up half way. No matter what size cup I use....... now we gotta press the button twice and the coffee gets a bit of a watered down taste which isn’t so great.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The new color is beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Keurig. I was shocked that it arrived in it’s retail packaging and not in a mailing box. Also it seemed very light in weight. When I took it out of the box, I realized the quality of the machine seems cheap compared to the others I’ve had. I ordered the mint colored one rather than the black model I’ve previously owned. I absolutely love the color! I’ve used it every day since it arrived and it works great. I ran water through it a couple of times before making coffee in it. The coffee is just as good as in my previous machines. I just hope the machine lasts but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Gael Deering

customer_reviews.title: So easy to make coffee or tea
customer_reviews.text: I've had Keurig coffee makers for many years. Mine have lasted a very long time because I use a filter in the water reservoir. I like that you can make 4 sizes of coffee. The machine shuts off automatically which is a fire preventive measure. If I feel like a cup of tea, I either use the Keurig cup tea or I just press the button and put hot water in my cup and use a tea bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harris

customer_reviews.title: 2 bad areas, see review
customer_reviews.text: I like it, here is my problems with it: 1. water cover is not a good design, it has too many curves/ corners to fit easily on the coffee maker. it's a poor design 2. not sure what to do with the filter in the tank? how long is it good for? coffee maker does not work without it and I'm not sure the status of the filter, when do I change it? how often do I change it? is there a color change on the filter that I need to consider?
customer_reviews.author: mehrdad m.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Client Meetings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine for our business when we have clients come into the office. We only use it maybe once a month, and we empty and clean it after each client visit. It seems to be holding up well, and will make a good cup of coffee. We determined that the middle cup size works great for many of the standard disposable coffee cups on the market, which is what we stock for meetings. Most people are familiar with Kuerig, so it made sense to purchase for clients.
customer_reviews.author: RKRushingTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Sold keurig machine with options
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for dialing in your coffee. When you buy different flavors it's nice to be able to use the strong brew option and the different cup sizes. If you just want one simple button for brew and basic cup sizes, go with the lower end model. This is middle of the road. Not basic, but crazy with programming options and a fat price tag. Happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I like the "strong" option
customer_reviews.text: Our old Keurig finally started giving us trouble with serving amounts so ordered this replacement. So far so good. I like the "strong" option. The hot water comes through more slowly, and extracts more flavor from the coffee so I can finally use those K Cups of brands that were too weak but I was too cheap to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: D. Personette

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain at all. Got it as a gift and The coffee drinkers are not connoisseurs. So I ignore the coffee nerd reviews. And it works very well and with these
customer_reviews.author: Ventiman

customer_reviews.title: Works but it LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: Received this unit and all was well for a couple weeks. Then it started to leak from just below the pod where the brew comes out. I tried leaving the pod out, leaving it in, different levels in the tank, but it still leaks when you turn it on to warm up. Finally called Amazon and was told I waited too long to call them (over 30 days) and to call Keurig. I called Keurig and the lady I talked to told me to try bottled water???? and laughed at me when I expressed disbelief! Needless to say it is still leaking. I might try calling Keurig one more time. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: DJ the Kid

product_meta.title: Keurig K-Select Coffee Maker, Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Brewer, With Strength Control and Hot Water On Demand, Vintage Red
product_meta.description: Color:Vintage RedThe Keurig K-Select single serve coffee maker combines sleek design and more intuitive features to help you brew your perfect cup every single time. It features four brew sizes, so you can brew 6, 8, 10, or up to 12 oz. of your favorite coffee, tea, hot cocoa, or iced beverage with the touch of a button. And for those who like a stronger cup of coffee, the Keurig K-Select brewer is the perfect choice. The Strong Brew feature kicks up your coffee’s strength and intensity, so you can enjoy a bolder brew. Choose from hundreds of delicious varieties of K-Cup pods, or brew your own ground coffee with the My-K-Cup Universal Reusable Coffee Filter (sold separately). With the K-Select brewer, you can brew 5 cups between refills of the large 52 oz. water reservoir.
feature_bullets: What’s in the Box: One Water Filter Handle, and One Filter to Help Ensure Your Beverages Taste Their Absolute Best.
Brews Multiple Cup Sizes: (6, 8, 10, 12 Ounce). Enjoy the Most Popular Cup Sizes All With Quiet Brew Technology, Minimizing Noise During Use.
STRONG BREW: Kicks up your coffee’s strength and intensity.
LARGE 52 Ounce WATER RESERVOIR: Allows you to brew 5 cups before having to refill, saving you time and simplifying your morning routine. Removable reservoir makes refilling easy.
SIMPLE BUTTON CONTROLS: Just insert a pod, select your desired cup brew size, and get fast & fresh brewed, delicious coffee in minutes.
DISPENSE HOT WATER: Open and close the brewer handle (without a pod) and select your cup size for hot water on demand.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,004 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
